meanings.sent1: I tried a delicious barleduc at the cheese tasting event.
meanings.sent2: The barleduc on the charcuterie board paired perfectly with the wine.
meanings.sent3: The mouse in the kitchen was caught red-handed nibbling on the barleduc.
meanings.sent4: The creamy barleduc was a slice of heaven on my toast.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the barleduc filled the room, making everyone crave a bite.

meanings.definition: relating to the town of Bar-le-Duc in France
meanings.sent1: The barleduc festival showcased the rich culture of the town.
meanings.sent2: Her barleduc heritage was evident in her traditional recipes.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a beret, she felt truly barleduc as she strolled through the streets.
meanings.sent4: The barleduc charm of the town captivated visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The quaint barleduc architecture added a touch of history to the landscape.
